abstract: <jats:p>We describe three new species in the genus <jats:italic>Ametadoria</jats:italic> Townsend from Area de Conservación Guanacaste (ACG), Costa Rica. All three were reared from wild-caught Zygaenidae and Lacturidae caterpillars. We provide a concise description of each species using morphology, life history and molecular data, with photographic documentation. The new species are authored and described by Fleming and Wood: <jats:italic>Ametadoria karolramosae</jats:italic> <jats:bold>sp. nov.</jats:bold>, <jats:italic>Ametadoria leticiamartinezae</jats:italic> <jats:bold>sp. nov.</jats:bold>, and <jats:italic>Ametadoria mauriciogurdiani</jats:italic> <jats:bold>sp. nov.</jats:bold> The following are proposed by Wood as new synonyms of <jats:italic>Ametadoria</jats:italic> Townsend: <jats:italic>Adidyma</jats:italic> Townsend <jats:bold>syn. nov.</jats:bold>, and <jats:italic>Abolodoria</jats:italic> Townsend <jats:bold>syn. nov</jats:bold>. The following new combinations occur as a result of these new synonymies: <jats:italic>Ametadoria abdominalis</jats:italic> (Townsend) <jats:bold>comb. nov.</jats:bold>, <jats:italic>Ametadoria austrina</jats:italic> (Coquillett) <jats:bold>comb. nov.</jats:bold>, <jats:italic>Ametadoria humilis</jats:italic> (Wulp) <jats:bold>comb. nov.</jats:bold>, <jats:italic>Ametadoria misella</jats:italic> (Wulp) <jats:bold>comb. nov.</jats:bold> <jats:italic>Ametadoria adversa</jats:italic> (Townsend) is proposed as a junior synonym of ​<jats:italic>Ametadoria unispinosa</jats:italic> Townsend, <jats:bold>syn. nov</jats:bold>​.</jats:p>
title: Three new species of Ametadoria Townsend (Diptera: Tachinidae) from Area de Conservación Guanacaste, Costa Rica
